translation.en: and a really large fish, the three tools of a hero!
translation.es: y un pescado muy grande. ¡Son las tres armas de un héroe!

translation.en: Hang on. That doesn't make any…
Speed, spirit and a very large…?
If I'm gonna tell this story…
- I've got to catch you up on everything. -
So, there was this town once, Baltese.
translation.es: Había una vez una ciudad llamada Baltese.

translation.en: Oh, you should have seen it.
- - Which I guess you are now, so, good.
translation.es: Y la están viendo ahora, bien.

translation.en: The sort of place where everything felt possible
translation.es: Era el tipo de lugar donde todo parecía posible

translation.en: like that lady making the fountain go nuts.
translation.es: Como lo que hace esa mujer ahí.

translation.en: Or these kids, doing some sophisticated, magical…
translation.es: O como estos niños, que hacen algo sofisticado, mágico…

translation.en: Anyway, times changed, like times do.
translation.es: En fin, los tiempos cambiaron, como suele pasar.

translation.en: And let me tell you, it wasn't good.
translation.es: Y les diré que no para mejor.

translation.en: There was the Great Foreign War, and after that, people in Baltese just stopped believing.
translation.es: Estalló la Gran Guerra y, después de eso, la gente de Baltese dejó de creer.
Ya nada parecía posible ni mágico.

translation.en: and then the clouds rolled in.
Strange clouds that never break or budge or snow.
translation.es: Nubes extrañas que nunca se van ni hacen que nieve.

translation.en: The town's been stuck, but things are about to get unstuck.
translation.es: La ciudad está estancada, pero las cosas están por desestancarse.

translation.en: I mean, otherwise, why would I tell this story? That'd be pretty boring.
translation.es: Si no, ¿para qué contaría esta historia? Sería muy aburrida.

translation.en: Peter is an orphan being raised by an old soldier.
translation.es: Peter es un niño huérfano al que lo cría un viejo soldado.

translation.en: The soldier knows about fighting and hardship and danger,
translation.es: El soldado sabe de combates, dificultades y peligros,

translation.en: so he's training the boy for that kind of life.
translation.es: y lo entrena para ese tipo de vida.

translation.en: But the boy knows there must be more.
translation.es: Pero el niño sabe que hay más.

translation.en: but as orphan, you have a rare privilege.
You can devote yourself to soldier's life.
translation.es: Puedes dedicar tu vida a ser soldado.

translation.en: Get our fish and bread now before you begin your marching.
translation.es: Trae el pescado y el pan ahora, antes de ponerte a marchar.

translation.en: Older bread the better, bread to make your teeth… strong,
translation.es: Que el pan sea viejo. Fortalece… los dientes.

translation.en: and small fish so you are accustomed to hunger.
translation.es: Y un pescado chico para acostumbrarte al hambre.

translation.en: - For what are we? - We're soldiers, sir.
- And what is this? - The world.
- Good morning, Mrs. Taylor. - Good morning, Peter.
translation.es: - Buen día, señora Taylor. - Buen día, Peter.

translation.en: Are you going to the opera tonight, madam?
Certainly. The only thing I enjoy in this town.
translation.es: Sí, es lo único que disfruto de esta ciudad.

translation.en: Ah, Peter, I saved you a beautiful piece today that you can't refuse.
translation.es: Peter, hoy te guardé un pescado buenísimo que no puedes rechazar.

translation.en: Hey, Peter. Here's the most disappointing fish for you.
translation.es: ¡Peter! Aquí tienes el pez más insulso.

translation.en: The most profound and difficult questions
translation.es: Las preguntas más profundas y complejas

translation.en: that could possibly be posed by the human heart or mind
translation.es: que puedan surgir del corazón o la mente humana

translation.en: will be answered for the price of one coin.
Your Guardian Vilna Lutz will be angry if you return without dinner.
translation.es: Vilna Lutz se enojará si vuelves sin la cena.

translation.en: Where'd you come from? How do you know that?
one day without food or the rest of your life without knowing?
translation.es: ¿un día sin comida o el resto de tu vida sin saber?

translation.en: - How do you-- ? - One coin, one question.
Well, my family died in the war when I was three years old. There was a battle--
translation.es: Mi familia murió en la guerra cuando yo tenía tres años. - Hubo… - Una batalla.

translation.en: Vilna Lutz rescued you, and he's raising you to be a soldier.
translation.es: Vilna Lutz te rescató y te entrena para ser soldado.

translation.en: When my father died, my mother--
translation.es: Cuando mi padre murió, mi mamá…

translation.en: She was expecting a child. I also know.
Sergeant Lutz told me that during the birth, both she and the baby died, but--
translation.es: El sargento Lutz me dijo que ella y la bebé murieron, pero…

translation.en: I held her. I know I did.
translation.es: ¿Tú la recuerdas? La sostuve en brazos, lo sé.

translation.en: She was so small and she was--
- Why did Vilna Lutz tell me-- ? - No.
You will only get one question, so be careful.
translation.es: Solo tienes una pregunta, así que con cuidado.

translation.en: Stop! Stop and think for a moment.
Think of the right question, Peter.
- You're having fun with me. - You have your answer.
translation.es: Te burlas de mí. Ya respondí.

translation.en: Follow the elephant? I gave you our one coin for today.
translation.es: ¿Que siga a la elefanta? Te di mi única moneda.

translation.en: You made a choice. You asked a question.
Follow the elephant and you'll find her.
translation.es: Sigue a la elefanta y la encontrarás.

translation.en: But there aren't any elephants here!
We have no dinner tonight because of Fortune Teller?
translation.es: ¿Hoy no tenemos cena por culpa de esa vidente?

translation.en: Yes, sir, but she knew so much about me! About you! I--
translation.es: Sí, señor, pero sabía mucho sobre mí y sobre usted…

translation.en: How could she know about me? I do not even know about me.
translation.es: ¿Cómo puede saber de mí? Ni yo sé sobre mí.

translation.en: She said that my sister lives
translation.es: Me dijo que mi hermana vive
y que siga a la elefanta.

translation.en: I know, sir. You've told me all these years that my sister--
translation.es: Ya sé, señor. Me dijo siempre que mi hermana…
Tu pobre madre y tu hermana…

translation.en: I saved you, which was all that I could do!
translation.es: Te salvé a ti, ¡fue lo único que pude hacer!

translation.en: A storybook? Who is Romain De Smedt-- ?
translation.es: ¿Un libro de cuentos? ¿Quién es Romain De…?

translation.en: Gimme, gimme, gimme! Romain De Smedt drive me crazy.
translation.es: ¡Dame eso! De Smedt me volvía loco.

translation.en: Young soldier I served with, good boy.
translation.es: Serví con él, era buen muchacho.

translation.en: But he read this book at night which remind him of home,
translation.es: Pero leía este libro cada noche. Le recordaba a su hogar, su madre, el confort.
Le recordaba a su hogar, su madre, el confort.

translation.en: I had to cure him of all of this.
- So I stole De Smedt's book. -
translation.es: así que le robé el libro.

translation.en: Without this book, he turned into the most fearsome soldier in army.
translation.es: Sin este libro, se volvió el soldado más temible del ejército.

translation.en: Why are you telling me this? Where there is comfort, there is innocence.
translation.es: - ¿Por qué me dice esto? - Si hay confort, hay inocencia.

translation.en: you were told… a fairy tale.
translation.es: te contaron un cuento de hadas.

translation.en: One just as false as any in this book!
translation.es: ¡Uno tan falso como los de este libro!

translation.en: Spyglass. Spyglass, Peter. Spyglass! Spyglass! Peter!
Yeah. That is a smart strategy.
If only I could find a pattern.
♪ Fish are small, bread is stale ♪
translation.es: Pan duro, un pez al día.

translation.en: ♪ Life is not a fairy tale ♪
translation.es: No es un cuento la vida.

translation.en: ♪ Fish are small, bread is stale ♪
translation.es: Pan duro, un pez al día.

translation.en: ♪ Life is not a fairy tale ♪
translation.es: No es un cuento la vida.

translation.en: ♪ Fish are small, bread is stale ♪
translation.es: Pan duro, un pez al día.

translation.en: - ♪ Life is not a fairy tale ♪ - Furry little paws.
♪ Fish are small, bread is stale ♪
translation.es: Pan duro, un pez al día.

translation.en: ♪ Life is not a fairy tale ♪
translation.es: No es un cuento la vida.

translation.en: ♪ Fish are small, bread is stale… ♪
translation.es: Pan duro, un pez al día…

translation.en: - Oh, what did you put in this? - Turmeric.
Typically, we're spared marching during the dinner hour.
translation.es: No solemos oírte marchar a la hora de la cena.

translation.en: Yes, sir. I have to do extra because I spent our dinner money on a Fortune Teller.
translation.es: Claro, señor. Hoy marcho más porque me gasté todo en una vidente.

translation.en: Mm. And what did they tell you?
To follow an elephant… which doesn't exist.
translation.es: Que siga a una elefanta… que no existe.

translation.en: My wife, she's tired of my what ifs.
translation.es: Mi esposa está cansada de mis y si.

translation.en: The elephant will lead me to my sister.
A child shouldn't live like that, marching and marching.
translation.es: Un niño no debería vivir así, siempre marchando.

translation.en: It's none of our business, Leo.
Now, at the exact same time across town,
translation.es: Al mismo tiempo, del otro lado de la ciudad,

translation.en: The opening act is a magician.
translation.es: La apertura es con un mago.

translation.en: - No, no, no, no, no, no! -
Can we just get it over with?
The Magician isn't great at magic,
translation.es: El mago no es bueno con la magia,

translation.en: but even if he was, he realizes this crowd wouldn't care.
translation.es: pero ve que, aunque lo fuera, a nadie aquí le importaría.

translation.en: He decides to try a powerful spell,
something to restore and revive all of Baltese.
translation.es: para recomponer y revivir a Baltese.

translation.en: One elegant, invisible moment of profound change.
translation.es: Un instante sutil e invisible que cambiaría todo.

translation.en: Like I said, he's not great at magic.
translation.es: Como dije, no es bueno con la magia.

translation.en: Hey! Hey, do you know what happened to the Fortune Teller's tent that was there?
translation.es: Oiga, ¿sabe qué pasó con la carpa de la vidente?

translation.en: Mm. Was a tent once. Maybe it was just laundry.
translation.es: Pero hubo. Quizá eran pilas de ropa.

translation.en: - Or a hat. I love hats. - Great.
Does anyone know where the tent is? The Fortune Teller!
- Have you seen a tent? - …an elephant.
An elephant? What? Wait, wait, wait!
Did you say elephant? Where is she?
They locked her up. And the Magician too.
translation.es: La encerraron, y al mago también.

translation.en: - And what that means is my sister lives! -
translation.es: Y eso significa… ¡que mi hermana está viva!

translation.en: She lives! She lives, Mrs. Taylor!
translation.es: ¡Está viva! - Está viva, Sra. Taylor. - ¡Qué bien!

translation.en: - Yes, an elephant! An elephant! - An elephant!
- I knew it would come. - You did?
No, but I had strong and unreasonable hopes.

translation.es: Y a veces, con eso basta.

translation.en: She's locked up somewhere, but I have to get her, sir.
translation.es: Está encerrada en algún lado, pero debo ir por ella.

translation.en: I'll barter or sneak or fight my way in somehow.
translation.es: Negociaré, me escabulliré o pelearé para entrar de alguna manera.

translation.en: But would you allow me to help?
But… how? I'll speak to the Countess and her advisers,
translation.es: - ¿Cómo? - Hablaré con la condesa y sus asesores.

translation.en: and you and I will… We'll figure it out together.
translation.es: Luego, tú y yo lo resolveremos juntos.

translation.en: No, sir. An elephant has arrived here!
- An elephant! - An elephant will do you no good!
But it must be true, then! My sister lives!
translation.es: Pero debe ser verdad, ¡mi hermana está viva!

translation.en: have you ever lied to me?
I'm saying she lives and I will find her.
translation.es: Digo que está viva y la voy a encontrar.

translation.en: - You, sir! Why did you do this to me? - Now, please--
translation.es: - ¿Por qué me hizo esto? - Por favor…

translation.en: - I didn't! - Oh, you most certainly did!
- You brought me on stage! - It was an accident.
translation.es: - ¡Me llevó al escenario! - Fue un accidente.

translation.en: Balderdash! You purposely crushed my leg with an elephant!
translation.es: ¡Patrañas! ¡Hizo caer a la elefanta sobre mí a propósito!

translation.en: No! It was… It was supposed to be…

translation.es: lirios. Sí, eso, un ramo de lirios.

translation.en: - A bouquet of lilies. - Hey! What is all this?
translation.es: Sí, eso, un ramo de lirios. ¿Qué es esto?

translation.en: No idea! It's outrageous! Remove it at once.
translation.es: Ni idea, es atroz. Sáquenlo todo.

translation.en: How could I produce an elephant on purpose when I can't even escape from a jail cell?
translation.es: ¿Cómo haría aparecer una elefanta si ni puedo escapar de aquí?

translation.en: - Lima beans, my least favorite legume. -
translation.es: Frijoles, las legumbres que más odio.

translation.en: You're behind bars where you belong.
- I'm going to make sure you stay there. -
translation.es: Y me aseguraré de que no salga.

translation.en: Direct, but polite. Strong, but respectful.
translation.es: Directo pero educado. Firme pero respetuoso.

translation.en: The Countess, she's fair and wise,
translation.es: La condesa es justa y sabia,

translation.en: and no one can remember the last time she laughed.
- She can sing! - Can she sing?
Thank you, Countess. I've come to ask where the elephant is kept.
translation.es: Gracias, condesa. Quisiera saber dónde está la elefanta.

translation.en: Have you been approached by a foreign power?
No. As captain of the palace guards, I need to know.
translation.es: No. Como capitán de la guardia, necesito saberlo.

translation.en: The elephant is dangerous. We don't even know where it came from.
translation.es: La elefanta es peligrosa, no sabemos de dónde salió.

translation.en: The elephant is a criminal, it is being treated as such.
translation.es: Es una criminal, la tratamos como tal.

translation.en: - This may just be the opening barrage. - Uh, what?
We must expect other beasts to be launched at us!
We commanded the Magician to disappear her! He says he's unable!
translation.es: Le ordenamos al mago que la hiciera desaparecer, y dice que no puede.

translation.en: - As such, we plan to destroy her! -
If a boy throws a rock through a window, can you blame the rock?
translation.es: Si un niño lanza una piedra a una ventana, ¿culpan a la piedra?

translation.en: - You're speaking of murder! - The elephant committed a crime!
The elephant is guilty of nothing except being an elephant!
translation.es: ¡Su único crimen es ser una elefanta!

translation.en: I'll continue to consider this until we meet tomorrow.
But let me say, Captain Matienne,
I take the safety of our town very seriously.
translation.es: que me tomo muy en serio la seguridad de la ciudad.

translation.en: She may need to be… gotten rid of.
Now, Leo Matienne sees one other way to keep the elephant alive.
translation.es: Ahora, Leo Matienne ve otra forma de salvar a la elefanta.

translation.en: - Mm. Huh? - …one, The King has never been to Baltese.
translation.es: Uno, el rey nunca ha ido a Baltese.

translation.en: …over the palace wall, landing safely in the moat.
translation.es: …sobre el muro del palacio, y caeremos de forma segura en el foso.

translation.en: Two, The King likes to be entertained.
translation.es: Dos, le gusta que lo entretengan.
y que nunca dejen de hacerlo.

translation.en: Hey, who wants a nougat? You like nougat?
And a doctor. And then they'll go again. Fantastic stuff.
translation.es: Y un doctor. Luego lo repetirán. Fantástico.

translation.en: An elephant came through a ceiling and hit an old lady.
translation.es: Una elefanta cayó por el techo y aplastó a una señora.

translation.en: - Peter, what are you doing? - Mr. Matienne?
I was going to come get you. I said I'd help you see the elephant.
translation.es: Iba a buscarte. Dije que te ayudaría a ver a la elefanta.

translation.en: Oh, uh, I guess I just…
I… I'm just not used to that.
Oh, this is the best, right?
I know! I know! I wish I'd been there.
Wow. Would you look at that.
I must admit, she is a magnificent creature.
translation.es: Debo admitir que es una criatura magnífica.

translation.en: - You did it! - Oh my God!
I'd like you to stay at the palace and tend to my elephant.
translation.es: Quisiera que te quedes a cuidarla.

translation.en: - Oh. - The kid's got pluck.  I love it!
I need the elephant to lead me to my lost sister. It is my destiny.
translation.es: Ella me llevará con mi hermana perdida. Es mi destino.

translation.en: I must ask you to give her to me.
translation.es: Le pido que me la entregue.

translation.en: The elephant is very dangerous, Peter. That's impossible.
translation.es: La elefanta es muy peligrosa, eso es imposible.

translation.en: I happen to like impossible things.
translation.es: A mí me gustan las cosas imposibles.

translation.en: Hey, what if Peter does three impossible things
translation.es: ¿Qué tal si Peter hiciera tres cosas imposibles

translation.en: Each day, I'll pick something impossible for the kid to do,
translation.es: Cada día, deberá hacer algo imposible.

translation.en: and if he does all three, thus proving his valor, strength, blah blah blah,
translation.es: Si hace las tres cosas y prueba su valor, fuerza, etc.,

translation.en: If not, I'll take it back with me.
translation.es: Si no, yo me la llevaré.

translation.en: It's a deal! You're terrific, Countess.
I like this place more and more, wherever we are.
translation.es: Cada vez me gusta más este lugar, donde sea que estemos.

translation.en: Okay, the first impossible task is…
translation.es: Bueno, la primera tarea imposible será…

translation.en: And an impossible fight is the best kind, right?
translation.es: Y las peleas imposibles son las mejores, ¿no?

translation.en: - Stands to reason, sir. - The kid's up for it! I told you.
Right? He's got some idea about the elephant. - And destiny and… - Uh…
translation.es: Tiene esta idea de la elefanta y el destino, y…

translation.en: I love it! Okay, tomorrow, noon, the kid fights my toughest soldier.
translation.es: ¡Me encanta! Mañana al mediodía, peleará con mi mejor soldado.

translation.en: Sabers it is! I love this kid! Give him my saber, Henri.
translation.es: ¡Sables! Amo a este chico. Dale mi sable, Henri.

translation.en: Unless you get killed, in which case, you know, I'll take it back.
translation.es: A menos que mueras. En ese caso, me lo quedo.

translation.en: Peter, has any of your training included sabers?
- No, sir. Broomsticks a bit. - Mm…
translation.es: No, señor. Con escobas a veces.

translation.en: Meet me at the store, if you like. I'll try to teach you.
translation.es: Ven a la tienda luego. Intentaré enseñarte.

translation.en: Oh, madness. How can the boy win?
Your what ifs will be the end of us, Leo Matienne.
translation.es: Tus y si serán nuestra ruina.

translation.en: I beg your pardon, ma'am. But how can two small words be so dangerous?
translation.es: Disculpe, pero ¿cómo dos palabras pueden ser tan peligrosas?

translation.en: In Leo Matienne's hands is how.
translation.es: En boca de Leo Matienne lo son.

translation.en: What if we put all our savings into raising pygmy goats?
translation.es: ¿Y si invertimos en la cría de cabras enanas?.

translation.en: If they could've been trained not to eat floors and walls.
translation.es: Si tan solo no se comieran los pisos y paredes.

translation.en: What if we import rare goods from the Far East?
translation.es: ¿Y si importamos artículos raros del Lejano Oriente?.

translation.en: Would've worked. If the entire shipment had not been eaten by pygmy goats.
translation.es: - Habría funcionado. - Si las cabras no hubieran comido todo.

translation.en: You see this roll of silk? My husband wanted to use it to kill himself.
translation.es: ¿Ves esta seda? Leo quería usarla para matarse.

translation.en: It's called a parachute, and there is evidence it can work.
translation.es: Es un paracaídas, y se probó que funcionaría.

translation.en: Actually, the results have been quite grisly. That's true. But what if I had been the first?
translation.es: No hubo buenos resultados. Pero ¿y si hubiera sido el primero?

translation.en: I'm going to practice on the mannequins.
- Leo… - But with no one to love him.
translation.es: - Leo… - Pero no tiene a nadie.

translation.en: And the two of us downstairs, all alone.
translation.es: Y nosotros dos, aquí abajo solos.

translation.en: God does not intend for us to have children, Leo Matienne.
translation.es: Dios no quiere que tengamos hijos, Leo.

translation.en: And who are we to say what God intends?
My heart has been broken too many times. It cannot bear your foolish questions.
translation.es: Ya sufrí demasiado, no aguanto tus preguntas tontas.

translation.en: But how? How will the world ever change if we do not question it?
translation.es: Pero ¿cómo va a cambiar el mundo si no lo cuestionamos?

translation.en: The world is what the world is and forever has been.
translation.es: El mundo es lo que es y siempre ha sido.

translation.en: For here is Peter, standing before us,
translation.es: Y aquí está Peter, ante nosotros,

translation.en: asking us to make it something different.
- Are you well? - I dreamt of an elephant, Sister.
I find elephant dreams particularly moving and portentous,
translation.es: Los sueños con elefantes son emocionantes y reveladores,

translation.en: although I'm forced to admit that I myself have never dreamt of an elephant.
translation.es: aunque debo admitir que yo nunca soñé con un elefante.

translation.en: It felt like the elephant came to take me somewhere.
translation.es: Sentí que quería llevarme a algún lado.

translation.en: Oh, but you belong right here, dear child, where you're safe.
translation.es: Pero tu lugar es aquí, querida, donde estás a salvo.

translation.en: I went out to see the world, Adele, and it was cruel.
translation.es: Yo salí a ver el mundo, Adele, y es muy cruel.

translation.en: So I brought you home to the orphanage,
translation.es: Por eso te traje al orfanato,

translation.en: And I named you Adele after your mother,
translation.es: Y te puse Adele, como tu madre,

translation.en: who's in heaven now with your brother.
translation.es: que está en el cielo con tu hermano.

translation.en: Mm. Do you think elephants have names?
Oh, yes. All creatures have names, dear.
and she hears her name spoken.
Somewhere she's known, somewhere she's loved.
translation.es: En algún lugar, la conocen y la aman.

translation.en: We met earlier, with the water.
translation.es: Nos conocimos antes, te di el agua.

translation.en: You may not know it yet, but…
you've been brought here to find my sister.
translation.es: pero estás aquí para encontrar a mi hermana.

translation.en: Uh, I don't know where she is.
To win you, I have to fight The King's toughest soldier tomorrow.
translation.es: Para ganarte, debo pelear con el mejor soldado del rey.

translation.en: all you have to do is just point on this map
and show me where my sister is.
Show me on this map here where she is.
translation.es: Muéstrame dónde está en este mapa.

translation.en: Are you a magic talking elephant?
Can you tell me where she is?
Can you speak? Just speak. Say it.
Looks like I have to fight tomorrow.
There's a boy fighting for the elephant.
translation.es: Un niño peleará por la elefanta.

translation.en: Peter, posta breve then moulinet! Remember, with the spin!
translation.es: Peter, posta breve y moulinet. ¡No olvides el giro!

translation.en: De Smedt, have you got the boy?
Romain De Smedt, young soldier I served with.
translation.es: Romain De Smedt, serví con él.

translation.en: I need the biggest fish you have, sir!
- What are you doing-- ? - Take this as payment.
I must find a way to infiltrate their ranks.
The book! The book! Look! The book! The book!
freed the dragon from his evil spell,
translation.es: liberó al dragón del malvado hechizo,

translation.en: and everyone lived happily ever after.
translation.es: y todos vivieron felices para siempre.

translation.en: Well, that's all for tonight, little carrot.
translation.es: Eso es todo por hoy, mi fosforito.
Solo uno más, mamá, por favor.

translation.en: All right, carrot. Just a teeny.
Do you believe a person can change?
I just beat you in battle, Sergeant.
I'm kind of amazed that worked.
You've done the first impossible task.
You've also lost my priceless family saber
and ruined a perfectly good killing machine.
translation.es: y arruinaste a mi máquina de matar.

translation.en: Hello, said Mr. Pig. Hello, said Mr. Rooster.
translation.es: Hola, dijo el cerdo. Hola, dijo el gallo.

translation.en: You're a surprisingly weird and dangerous young man.
translation.es: Eres un jovencito sorprendentemente extraño y peligroso,

translation.en: - And I like that. - Thank you, sir.
translation.es: y eso me gusta. Gracias, señor.

translation.en: Now, tomorrow, for the second impossible task…
translation.es: Para mañana, la segunda tarea imposible será…

translation.en: - How? - Hello? It's supposed to be impossible.
The kid just beat Goliath. You want him to bob for apples?
translation.es: Ya venció a Goliat. ¿Quieren que atrape manzanas?

translation.en: Plus, we've had some people nearly fly.
translation.es: Y hubo gente que casi voló.

translation.en: Tomorrow at noon, we'll all meet in the square
translation.es: Nos reuniremos en la plaza y veremos al niño volar…

translation.en: and watch the kid fly or crash or both.
translation.es: Nos reuniremos en la plaza y veremos al niño volar… o estrellarse o ambas cosas.

translation.en: Like, like he really gets going but then, whammo!
translation.es: Como que está subiendo, y luego, ¡pum!

translation.en: No, of course not. No. Um…
I will get you water, and then I will learn how to fly
translation.es: Te traeré agua y me iré a aprender a volar,

translation.en: and then I will get you out of here.
translation.es: y luego te sacaré de aquí

translation.en: And we can find my sister.
The elephant cannot understand human speech,
translation.es: Aunque no entiende lo que dice,

translation.en: but she can look at a face and recognize friendship.
translation.es: la elefanta reconoce la amistad en su rostro.

translation.en: but she does finally feel something like… hope.
translation.es: pero al fin siente un poco de esperanza.

translation.en: And hope can spread from one person to the next.
translation.es: Y la esperanza se contagia de una persona a otra.

translation.en: - He ran off like lightning! - I know! I saw it with my own eyes.
translation.es: - ¡Salió disparado! - Sí, lo vi con mis propios ojos.

translation.en: He bestowed upon me this sword in exchange for one cod.
translation.es: Me dio esta espada por un bacalao.

translation.en: I can't wait to see what he has to do next.
translation.es: Ya quiero ver qué más hace.

translation.en: I'm going early to get a good spot.
He held up a book! - Like an avenging librarian!
- Incredible! Who knows what's next? - It could be anything.
In the hydrangeas? In the city!
An elephant has appeared under miraculous circumstances.
No, no, no, no! We do not go to the city.
translation.es: No, no. No vamos a la ciudad.

translation.en: It is unsafe. Some harm could befall you.
translation.es: No es seguro, podría pasarte algo.

translation.en: But… my dream. This is a sign.
translation.es: Pero mi sueño… Esto es una señal.

translation.en: I do not believe in signs.
Yes.  I do, in fact, believe in signs.
translation.es: Sí, de hecho, creo en las señales.

translation.en: Perhaps you do not understand. My legs were crushed!
translation.es: Quizá no lo entiende. Me aplastó las piernas…

translation.en: Yes, she comes here every day.
- My legs were crushed! - Go get help, boy.
translation.es: ¡Me aplastó las piernas! - Ve por ayuda. - ¡La elefanta!

translation.en: I know, your legs were crushed by an elephant.
translation.es: Lo sé, la elefanta le aplastó las piernas.

translation.en: I just intended a bouquet of lilies.
Just admit you crushed my legs with your tricks.
translation.es: Admita que me rompió las piernas con sus trucos.

translation.en: It was an accident. I intended a bouquet of lilies.
translation.es: Fue un accidente. Quería hacer aparecer unos lirios.

translation.en: Peter. Peter, just stop. Stop this minute!
- Sir-- - Soldiers do not fly! I forbid it!
translation.es: Señor… ¡Los soldados no vuelan! ¡Te lo prohíbo!

translation.en: With De Smedt, you were lucky,
I beat De Smedt, and I believe I will fly!
translation.es: Vencí a De Smedt, ¡y creo que podré volar!

translation.en: And I believe you will be crushed flat. Dead.
translation.es: Y yo creo que te estrellarás y morirás.

translation.en: but I have no idea how to do that.
Vilna says that I'm going to die. Like I don't know!
translation.es: Vilna dice que voy a morir. ¡Como si no lo supiera!

translation.en: I have to fly tomorrow. I have to.
Come inside. You need to eat.
Okay, Peter, now, about this flying business.
translation.es: Bueno, Peter, sobre esto de volar…

translation.en: As soon as you see the elephant,
translation.es: En cuanto la veas, nos volvemos al orfanato,

translation.en: we're going back to the orphanage where we're safe.
translation.es: En cuanto la veas, nos volvemos al orfanato, donde estamos a salvo.

translation.en: - Help you with your luggage, Sister? - Oh!
Now you see why we don't travel to the city, Adele.
translation.es: Ya ves por qué no venimos a la ciudad.

translation.en: If only I'd kept the boy. The boy.
translation.es: Si me hubiera quedado con el niño…

translation.en: Please, listen. You have to get out of here.
Take the children. I'll meet you there.
translation.es: Lleve a los niños. Iré para ahí.

translation.en: I'm a soldier. I don't know how to care for a newborn.
translation.es: Soy un soldado, no sé cómo cuidar a una bebé.

translation.en: Of course. Just the boy, then.
Please, I can't do it alone.
translation.es: Por favor, no puedo yo sola.

translation.en: All right. But you have to leave at once.
translation.es: Está bien, pero debe irse ya.

translation.en: I'll gather things for the baby and meet you at the garrison. Now, go!
translation.es: Juntaré las cosas de la bebé e iré para el cuartel. ¡Vaya!

translation.en: I should have taken them both.
But I'll keep you safe. I'm a soldier.
translation.es: Pero estarás a salvo, soy un soldado.

translation.en: It's not safe here, Sister! The enemy is coming!
translation.es: No es seguro aquí. ¡Ya viene el enemigo!

translation.en: If only I'd kept the boy with me.
translation.es: Si me hubiera quedado con el niño…

translation.en: - A new day. - Hey, everybody! Hello!
Great day to watch the kid fly, eh? Not a cloud in the…
translation.es: Es un gran día para ver volar al niño. No hay ni una nube en…

translation.en: because, you know, with a tan…
I'm still King, right? I didn't miss a coup or something.
translation.es: Aún soy el rey, ¿no? ¿No me derrocaron ni nada?

translation.en: Not since her brother died in the war.
translation.es: No desde que su hermano murió en la guerra.

translation.en: They said the elephant would be here. Can you see her, Sister?
translation.es: Dijeron que la elefanta estaría aquí. ¿La ve, hermana?

translation.en: - No, stay with me! Stay with me! -
Okay. Let's see something impossible. Uh, where's the kid?
translation.es: Bien, veamos algo imposible. ¿Dónde está el niño?

translation.en: - He'll be all right. - Uh- huh. Yes, sure.
- What is it? - The boy, he slipped.
I knew the kid could fly!
What is possible? It's possible! It's possible!
All right, I flew! What's next?
Well, you've done the second impossible task,
so, you are one step away from owning an elephant!
translation.es: así que estás a un paso de tener una elefanta.

translation.en: It doesn't sound great when I say it out loud. A lot of cleaning up.
translation.es: No suena muy bien en voz alta. Mucho que limpiar. Montones.
No suena muy bien en voz alta. Mucho que limpiar. Montones. En fin, bien.

translation.en: - Okay, for the third impossible task… -
No, I'm a spur- of- the- moment kind of king, you know?
translation.es: No, soy de esos reyes que improvisan.

translation.en: I… I come up with things on the fly, you know?
translation.es: Se me ocurren las cosas sobre la marcha, ¿sabe?

translation.en: It's a joke. God, it's a quip, but…
translation.es: Fue un chiste, un chascarrillo, pero…

translation.en: Nope. Nope. Sorry. Stand down, son.
I just get like this when I'm about to say something incredible.
translation.es: Hago esto cuando voy a decir algo increíble.

translation.en: you will make the Countess laugh.
translation.es: es que hagas reír a la condesa.

translation.en: What part of impossible is tripping you people up?
Im, not. Poss, the middle part… Im… Something…
translation.es: Im es no, posi, lo del medio. Im, algo…

translation.en: Okay, I have no idea, but it means
Anyone thinks they're better than this kid, you're next jumping off the cathedral wearing a tent.
translation.es: Quien se crea mejor tendrá que saltar de la catedral también.

translation.en: You should stop worrying about the kid and figure out who'll get me an ice cream.
translation.es: Ya dejen de preocuparse por él y tráiganme un helado.

translation.en: Anyone? Hello? Why are we all standing here?
It's me, from the dream. Do you remember?
I'm here. Can you tell me why?
This one may really be impossible.
Maybe they'd let me jump off the cathedral again.
translation.es: ¿Me dejarán saltar de la catedral otra vez?

translation.en: I could write you a joke.
You're probably just not very funny.
Right, and I'm sure you're hilarious.
translation.es: Y seguro que tú eres comiquísima.

translation.en: It's unlike me to say something so insulting.
translation.es: No suelo decir cosas tan ofensivas.

translation.en: And I've never hit a person in my life.
translation.es: Y yo nunca le pegué a nadie.

translation.en: - But I-- - Oh, there you are!
Well, now that you've seen the elephant…
translation.es: Bueno, ahora que ya viste a la elefanta…

translation.en: Now we can go home. But, Sister--
translation.es: - Ya podemos ir a casa. - Pero, hermana…

translation.en: We'll get a good night's sleep, then go back to where we belong.
translation.es: Dormiremos bien y volveremos a nuestro lugar.

translation.en: what I have to say right now.
translation.es: lo que voy a decirte ahora.

translation.en: I could have saved her. I left her with the nurse.
translation.es: Podría haberla salvado, pero la dejé con la enfermera.

translation.en: We were supposed to meet at the garrison, but there was an explosion.
translation.es: Íbamos a reunirnos en el cuartel, y hubo una explosión.

translation.en: I… I didn't think I could tend to you both.
translation.es: No me creía capaz de cuidarlos a ambos.

translation.en: What do I know about an infant?

translation.es: en la guerra, en la vida,

translation.en: I could have saved you both.
because I didn't want to cause you any more pain.
translation.es: porque no quería causarte más dolor.

translation.en: You stood before an impossible opponent…
translation.es: Te enfrentaste a un oponente imposible…

translation.en: Well, then, tell me a joke.
A horse walked into a bar. Um, maybe it can't walk into it.
translation.es: Un caballo entra a un bar. Quizá no puede entrar.

translation.en: No, I didn't mean to hurt you or make an elephant appear,
translation.es: No, no quería lastimarla ni hacer aparecer una elefanta,

translation.en: but I wasn't trying for a bouquet of lilies either.
When I stood on that stage facing all of you,
translation.es: Al verlos a todos desde el escenario,

translation.en: Even now, you see magic right before you,
translation.es: Es igual ahora que ven la magia,

translation.en: Granted, a fractured magic, sloppy, accidental, but…
translation.es: Sí, es una magia imperfecta, torpe y accidental,

translation.en: To which you respond, Stop, as you would to some minor nuisance.
translation.es: Y solo dicen basta, como si fuera un fastidio.

translation.en: That night, I tried to cast a spell on you and everyone else there.
translation.es: Esa noche, quise hechizarlos a usted y a los demás

translation.en: A spell to make you believe again, to care about magic,
translation.es: para que volvieran a creer y les importara la magia,
porque las cosas extraordinarias son posibles…

translation.en: But I had no business attempting such a powerful spell,
translation.es: Pero no debí haber intentado hacer un hechizo tan poderoso,

translation.en: because I'm not a very good magician.
translation.es: porque no soy muy buen mago.

translation.en: I tried for mystery and wonderment.
translation.es: Apunté al misterio y el asombro…

translation.en: I know you're worried about the Countess laughing,
translation.es: Sé que te preocupa que la condesa no se ría,

translation.en: but I've got a great joke.
And I've got it under control. You gotta trust me.
I feel like you're not taking me seriously. I'm a dangerous man.
translation.es: No me tomas en serio. Soy un tipo peligroso.

translation.en: - I beat a giant, I jumped off a building. -
translation.es: Vencí a un gigante, salté de un edificio…

translation.en: Okay, okay. There'll be plenty of time for messing about later.
translation.es: Bueno, bueno. Ya habrá tiempo para bromear luego.

translation.en: We just have to concentrate on the final task, but…
translation.es: Tenemos que concentrarnos en la tarea, pero…

translation.en: Oh, I can't wait to get you out of here.
translation.es: No veo la hora de sacarte de aquí.

translation.en: We're gonna have so much fun and so many adventures…
translation.es: Nos vamos a divertir y tendremos muchas aventuras…

translation.en: Hey, wake up. It's time now.
Everyone's here, Peter. The third task.
translation.es: Todos están aquí para la tercera tarea.

translation.en: You must really miss them. I thought you were taking me back to my family.
translation.es: Debes extrañarlos mucho. Creí que me llevarías con mi familia…

translation.en: I need to get you back to yours.
translation.es: pero debo llevarte yo con la tuya.

translation.en: It's time for the third impossible task!
translation.es: ¡Llegó la hora de la tercera tarea imposible!

translation.en: Will the kid finally win the elephant?
translation.es: ¿El niño se ganará a la elefanta?

translation.en: Now, if at any point I hear the Countess laugh,
translation.es: Si escucho reír a la condesa en cualquier momento,

translation.en: you walk away with the elephant.
So, there's a farmer and a fisherman.
translation.es: Bueno, hay un granjero y un pescador.

translation.en: - They're out in a field together. - Solid start. Classic.
translation.es: Están en un campo. Buen comienzo.

translation.en: When they hear a funny kind of croaking noise,
they look over towards the pond and they see a hen.
translation.es: miran hacia el lago y ven a una gallina.

translation.en: The hen's got this piece of string,
and she's working the string in and out of the mouth of a frog by the pond,
translation.es: que la mantiene atada a una rana sobre la que se apoya.

translation.en: up and down with the string in the frog's mouth.
So, the fisherman says, Why do you think the hen's doing that?
translation.es: El pescador dice: ¿Por qué la gallina hará eso?.

translation.en: The farmer turns to the fisherman and says,
Well, sure, it's the same question as always, isn't it?
translation.es: Bueno, es lo mismo de siempre, ¿no?

translation.en: Why did the chicken floss the toad?
Nailed it! Funny stuff, Peter! Funny stuff!
Why did the chicken-- ? Because it sounds like…
If you're not gonna take this seriously, Countess, then what's the point?
translation.es: Si no va a tomar esto en serio, ¿qué sentido tiene?

translation.en: You have to let me take her,
translation.es: Deben dejar que me la lleve, pero no por mí.

translation.en: but not for me, for her.
translation.es: Deben dejar que me la lleve, pero no por mí. Por ella.

translation.en: All this time, I've tried to win the elephant to find my family,
translation.es: La quería para encontrar a mi familia,

translation.en: but she has a family and she was taken from them.
translation.es: pero ella también tiene la suya y los separaron.

translation.en: The elephant might have a sister too.
translation.es: Quizá la elefanta tenga una hermana.

translation.en: I know the joke didn't work,
translation.es: Sé que el chiste no funcionó,

translation.en: but please, the elephant didn't ask to be brought here.
translation.es: pero, por favor, la elefanta no pidió que la trajeran aquí.

translation.en: We have to send her home.
No, no, no, no, no, no.
You had one last thing to do, and I don't see her laughing.
translation.es: Tenías una última cosa que hacer, y no la veo reírse.

translation.en: Grab the elephant and we'll roll.
Okay, I know. This is impossible.
translation.es: Sí, lo sé. Esto es imposible.

translation.en: Think of all of the impossible things you've done,
translation.es: Piensen en todo lo imposible que hicieron.

translation.en: Have you ever gotten through one of them alone?
Of course not. That would be absurd.
translation.es: Claro que no. Eso sería absurdo.

translation.en: Peter fought and flew and defied a king,
translation.es: Peter peleó, voló y desafió a un rey,
y puede que se sienta solo,

translation.en: All right, kid, you did it.
But… but it was the elephant.
She's laughing, right? That's all I really wanted.
translation.es: Se está riendo, ¿no? Es lo único que quería.

translation.en: Things are only impossible till they're not.
translation.es: Las cosas son imposibles hasta que no lo son.

translation.en: We did it! We did it!
How will we get her home?
Carried over the mountains by larger elephants!
translation.es: Por la montaña, ¡cargada por otros elefantes!

translation.en: That seemed good until I said it out loud.
This boy says the elephant must go home.
translation.es: Este niño dice que la elefanta debe volver a su hogar.

translation.en: You've seen what happens when I attempt that spell.
translation.es: Ya vio lo que pasa cuando hago ese hechizo.

translation.en: Sir, the elephant deserves to be with her family.
translation.es: Señor, la elefanta merece estar con su familia.

translation.en: Yeah, that's a lovely idea, but look around you.
translation.es: Sí, es una linda idea, pero mira a tu alrededor.

translation.en: Nonsense! - You brought an elephant through the roof. -
translation.es: ¡Tonterías! Hizo que apareciera una elefanta por el techo,

translation.en: And don't you realize it started something here?
translation.es: ¿y no se da cuenta de que dio inicio a algo más?

translation.en: The very thing you wished for.
Hey, magic man! Let's send the big lady home!
I believe that you can perform the necessary magic.
translation.es: Creo que puede hacer la magia que se necesita

translation.en: I believe that only you can set things right.
translation.es: y que solo usted puede arreglar esto.

translation.en: In my dream, I was meant to follow her.
I do not believe in dreams.
Yes, I do, in fact, believe in dreams.
translation.es: Sí, de hecho, creo en los sueños.

translation.en: I heard it was different here before.
translation.es: Dicen que aquí era distinto antes.

translation.en: There was light, there was life, there was hope.
The perfect kind of town to make an elephant disappear.
translation.es: Era la ciudad perfecta donde hacer desaparecer a una elefanta.
pero no es el de ella.

translation.en: It's hard to lose a friend.
We have to say goodbye now.
and I believe that he can send her home!
translation.es: ¡y creo que puede enviarla a su hogar!

translation.en: That is how it will be accomplished.
Belief is a great and invisible thing.
translation.es: La fe es algo enorme e invisible.

translation.en: It comes over us like sleep.
We struggle along the edges, fighting it for reasons we cannot name…
translation.es: Al principio, nos resistimos sin saber bien por qué…
hasta que, como con el sueño,

translation.en: We stop… and we are restored.
I can't believe I just saw magic!
- What's happening? - Look at the clouds!
- What is it? - It's sun, my darling.
You were meant to follow her to your destiny.
translation.es: Iba a llevarte hacia tu destino.

translation.en: Come on now, Adele. Time to go home.
translation.es: Vamos, Adele. Es hora de irnos.

translation.en: This is… this is my sister.
- First of all-- Let me just say-- - You're alive! And here!
I'm sorry for the harm I've caused you, madam.
translation.es: Lamento todo el daño que le causé.

translation.en: Just look at the place now.
A town restored. Can you see?
translation.es: Volvió a ser lo que era, ¿lo ven?

translation.en: You've been visiting for a while.
I know, but every time I try to leave,
translation.es: Sí, pero, cada vez que intento irme, pareciera ser…
Sí, pero, cada vez que intento irme, pareciera ser… imposible.

translation.en: Just then, the magic coral woke up
translation.es: Entonces, el coral mágico se despertó

translation.en: and chased the oysters away shouting--
translation.es: y les gritó a las ostras….

translation.en: - Ooh, that was really scary. - Thank you.
How do you find exotic yarn?
Oh, I've got my secrets, you know? I'm a big city lady.
translation.es: Tengo mis secretos. Soy una mujer de ciudad.

translation.en: Tell me you didn't make the goat more pajamas. All he does is eat them.
translation.es: No le hicieron otro pijama, ¿no? Se los come.

translation.en: Yes, but he likes eating pajamas.
she lives a really long time,
long enough to test even an elephant's memory.
translation.es: como para poner a prueba hasta su gran memoria.

translation.en: But of course, she never forgets Peter.
translation.es: Pero, por supuesto, nunca olvidó a Peter.
